page.title: 12Farming in Fulford
page.content: When the wheat and barley are harvested they are machine dried and stored in one of four closed barns. Another barn is used to house the dairy herd.The two remaining closed barns are used to store machinery. There are two dutch barns used for storing hay and straw. The farm has its own milking parlour where the cows are milked twice each day. The milk is used in chocolate production at Holme on Spalding Moor. Like most farmers Mr. Bramley is his own fitter ,mechanic, builder and accountant. Short wave radio operator and computer operator might be added to that list shortly. Mrs Bramley can operate most of the farm machinery and drive a tractor. Their children are learning various farming skills and help during busy times and holidays.
